remarks: An inverse in the fundamental group.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Feb-2015.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 10-Aug-2015.)
statement:
pi1grp.2 $e |- G = ( J pi1 Y ) $.
pi1inv.n $e |- N = ( invg ` G ) $.
pi1inv.j $e |- ( ph -> J e. ( TopOn ` X ) ) $.
pi1inv.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. X ) $.
pi1inv.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. ( II Cn J ) ) $.
pi1inv.0 $e |- ( ph -> ( F ` 0 ) = Y ) $.
pi1inv.1 $e |- ( ph -> ( F ` 1 ) = Y ) $.
pi1inv.i $e |- I = ( x e. ( 0 [,] 1 ) |-> ( F ` ( 1 - x ) ) ) $.
pi1inv $p |- ( ph -> ( N ` [ F ] ( ~=ph ` J ) ) = [ I ] ( ~=ph ` J ) ) $.
$d F x $.
$d G x $.
$d J x $.
$d Y x $.
$d ph x $.
